result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha E. Grulkowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 
1:39pm
INCLUDES 15CF419, 15CF918, 15CF935, and 15CF1024
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Wallace
Date and time set for sentencing hearing

State says was originally set for argued sentencing and now will have joint recommendation
Atty Wallace in agreement with proceeding with joint recommendation
COURT notes both parites have received PSI and are not objecting to PSI findings
PSI to be kept by both parties in confidential matter
VRCW.
Atty Wallace makes statement prior to sentencing


COURT ORDERS: 15CF419: Ct. 1 Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC, Ct. 2 Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC, and Ct. 3 Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC- each count 7 and a half years WSPS: 2 and a half years IC, 5 years ES. 15CF918 Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine- repeater- 3 and a half years WSPS: 1 and a half years IC, 2 years ES, concurrent to all other sentencing. CONDITONS of ES: Complete any assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent, includes all follow up for AODA assessment and drug addiction issues. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, with random testing to check for compliance. Complete mental health evaluation and all recommended follow up. Enroll and complete LEAP parenting programming. No contact with co-defendants: J.L., J.G., and D.W. No contact with victims- M.G., D.M., A.W., D.M., D.S., and M.S. Pay back restitution that is joint and several to victims- A.W. of $18,455.00 and D.M. of $9,174.28. Initially paid at 25% of prison wages and remaining balance due then as payments on ES. 
Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Credit for 143 days granted for all 4 sentences. Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Programming and Substance Abuse Programming. 

Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Prison. 

Adj: 2:05pm

from Br. 1 JA to Atty John Wallace and ADA Lisa Gramer 
Includes 15CF419, 15CF918, 15CF935, and 15CF1024
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 2:15pm
INCLUDES 15CF419, 15CF918, 15CF935, and 15CF1024
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Wallace

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State moves to:
15CF419:
Ct. 4 Burglary-Building or Dwelling, PTAC, as a party to a crime >> D&RI
Ct. 5 Burglary-Building or Dwelling, PTAC, as a party to a crime >> D&RI
Ct. 6 Burglary-Building or Dwelling, PTAC, as a party to a crime >> D&RI
15CF918: 
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping - Felony >> D&RI
15CF935: 
Ct. 1 Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce or Store Methamphetamine, PTAC, as party to a crime >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping - Felony - repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping - Felony - repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> D&RI
15CF1024:
Ct. 1 Battery by Prisoners - repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping - Felony - repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping - Felony - repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CF419:
Ct. 1 Burglary-Building or Dwelling, PTAC, as a party to a crime >> GUILTY
Ct. 2 Burglary-Building or Dwelling, PTAC, as a party to a crime >> GUILTY
Ct. 3 Burglary-Building or Dwelling, PTAC, as a party to a crime >> GUILTY
15CF918: 
Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine - repeater >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: PSI report completed and to set sentencing date 60-90 days out
Dates: to be set with Br 1 JA

Adj: 2:30pm
Atty Wallace to met with client this week - PTC 12/10/15 @ 9am

cc: Br. 1

No contact with victim(s):  K.S.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
